title: Feijoada (Brazilian Black Bean Stew)
ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) package dry black beans, soaked overnight
½ pound thickly sliced bacon, diced
method: Step 2: Heat oil in a large pot or Dutch oven. Add 3/4 cup chopped onion, green onions, and garlic; cook and stir until softened, about 4 minutes.
Step 3: Pour in soaked beans and fill with enough water to cover beans by 3 inches. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer uncovered for 2 hours, or until tender.
Step 4: While beans are cooking, place ham hocks in a smaller pot with 1/4 cup chopped onion.
Step 5: Cover with water and simmer until meat pulls off of the bone easily, about 1 hour.
Step 6: Drain and add to beans. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Step 7: Place ham, bacon, and remaining onion in a baking dish. Bake until mixture is crispy, 15 minutes.
Step 8: Drain bacon and ham mixture and add to beans. Season with bay leaves, coriander, salt, and pepper. Simmer, uncovered, 30 minutes more.
Step 9: Stir in chopped cilantro and parsley just before serving.
